comment._content: nla.gov.au/nla.news-article128516855 - ??? possibly 'Peggy Petite', a cabaret artist... [a few minutes later] nla.gov.au/nla.news-page13811126 me thinks!!! comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] bit of a find that one! She seems to drop off the radar after September 1927, but maybe that will change as more newspapers are digitised. I suspect the identities of quite a few subjects of the stage related Hall portraits might emerge as more of the lower brow newspapers are digitised. In the last few weeks I've been browsing thru numerous  issues of the Sunday Times...it's definitely Parental Guidance Recommended territory...full of articles about the seamier side of life...razor gangs, drugs, gambling, political corruption, dreaded communists and Langites (!)...it provides a very different view of 1920s Sydney to the one obtained via the SMH and the Sydney Mail. Hardly a church warden in sight...well almost...for all its voyeurism and obsession with sleaze, the Sunday Times nevertheless managed to include a regular page devoted to religion and church news.

The additional pics of 'Peggy Petite' are good too by the way! The Wentworth Cabaret must have been a cool place to hang out in 1927...one item refers to it being open until 1.00am!
